p: The papain-like protease (PL pro) encoded by SARS-CoV cleaves the viral replicase polyprotein. Since this enzymatic activity is important for viral infection, PL pro is a target of interest in the development of antiviral therapies. Nine diarylheptanoids from the bark of Alnus japonica (Thunb.) Steud. were evaluated for their inhibitory activities against SARS-CoV PL pro (Park et al., 2012a). Hirsutenone was found to be the most potent inhibitor of SARS-CoV PL pro (IC 50 of 4.1 ± 0.3 μM).
